tracks.text: A knight in a red cape enters a castle
Late at night, the band plays in the castle courtyard.
Doors to the throne room open. Party guests turn to look at the knight.
The knight approaches a princess lying, unmoving, on a table. The king, surrounded by attractive maids, glares at the knight.
The king is played by drummer Justin Foley. He glares and bites a turkey leg.
The knight removes his helmet. It's bassist Mike D'Antonio.
The princess is played by guitarist Adam Dutkiewicz.
Vocalist Howard Jones plays a blacksmith, working on a forge. The knight walks in, and the blacksmith nods. He raises a sword and throws it to the knight.
The townspeople and king watch as the knight heads off for the forest
A wizard watches the knight through a crystal ball, which sees what the shadowy figure sees. The wizard is played by guitarist Joel Stroetzel.
The knight approaches a tower.
The knight opens the tower's door and grabs a torch.
The knight finds a book on a glowing pedestal. He makes an impressed shrug.
The knight turns a page in the book and mouths the word "what"
The knight is surrounded by shadowy figures with red eyes. He lifts his sword and strikes. The wizard watches through a crystal ball and frowns.
The wizard throws the crystal ball and it shatters in glowing sparks.
Back in the throne room, the knight kneels over the princess, book in hand. The wizard appears behind the knight.
The wizard conjures shadowy void magic. The townspeople hold the knight back.
The king holds the book. Pages turn. The princess's finger twitches.
The wizard suddenly stops.
The wizard falls forward, as the blacksmith retrieves a sword for the wizard's back.
The knight stands before a delighted princess.
The knight and princess embrace. The princess is more than a head taller than the knight.
The king smiles and eats a turkey leg, while flanked by attractive maids.
The blacksmith kisses his sword. Fade to black.
